page.title: 08LUDLOW MAY FAIR
page.content: There has been a May fair in Ludlow since it was granted as a right in the Charter of Incorporation in 1461.It became a Funfair in the middle of the 19th century and has always been held in the streets of the town. There are such rides as the Waltzers,Dodgem cars,Octopus and Big Wheel costing about 30p to 50p for a 3 minute ride.Various side-shows and foodstalls add to the whole atmosphere. The fair stays for 3 days,including May 1st. causing much confusion and upheaval in the town. Local tradespeople have tried repeatedly to remove it from the streets without success.The May fair is here to stay and enjoyed by many ..... young and old.
